purpose: The purpose of this code is to collect system information and send it to external domains for tracking purposes.
anomalies: Use of hardcoded IP address in source code
Sending sensitive system information to external domains without user consent
Use of insecure HTTP requests with rejectUnauthorized set to false
Dynamic generation of URLs with random numbers for tracking purposes
analysis: This code appears to be part of a malicious package that collects system information including IP address, hostname, username, and directory paths, then sends this data to third-party servers. The use of multiple domains with randomized paths suggests attempts at obfuscation and evasion. It's using insecure HTTP connections which can lead to man-in-the-middle attacks. The code also uses dynamic URL construction which could be used for various tracking mechanisms.
conclusion: This code exhibits clear characteristics of malicious behavior including unauthorized data collection and exfiltration to external servers.
